task.summary: Default task
helper.h, helper.c - repaired ip_address string allocation and sizeof ip_address
server.h, server.c - echo() func implemented
server.h, server.c - echo() func updated
server - decomposition into modules and refactoring
server - broken make.txt repaired
server - removed warnings
server - restricting passive socket only to AF_INET address family
passive_socket - restoration of AF_UNSPEC ai_family property on addressinfo hints
passive_socket - setsockopt IPV6_V6ONLY to NO (0)
concurrency/thread.h, concurrency/thread.c - first draft of connection thread implementation
collections/doubly_linked_list.h, collections/doubly_linked_list.c - first draft

implemented: collections/doubly_linked_list.h, collections/doubly_linked_list.c test/assertion.h, test/assertion.c test/test_doubly_linked_list.h, test/test_doubly_linked_list.c common/fifo_queue.h, common/fifo_queue.c test/test_fifo_queue.h, test/test_fifo_queue.c
deleted const void * data, const size_t to enable modification of data inside doubly linked list nodes e.g. by using travers_forward, travers_backward and its data_handler_t functions
task_queue.h, task_queue.c - first draft
task_queue.h, task_queue.c - first draft, task counter added in the task queue
task_queue.c - implementation of enqueue_task() and dequeue_task() function using pthread_mutex_t and pthread_cond_t (conditional variable) to replicate producer-consumer model
task_queue.h, task_queue.c - implemented, not tested
task_queue.h, task_queue.c - refactored and tested test_task_queue.h, test_task_queue.c - implemented and tested
thread_pool.h, thread_pool.c - skeleton of implementation
array_helper.h, array_helper.c - implemented functions to find and remove elements in arrays of ints or arrays of pointers (void *)
array_helper.h, array_helper.c - fixed some bugs ex. const elem_t *elem param to const elem_t elem param
test_array_helper.h, test_array_helper.c - implemented, all tests passed

thread_pool.c - implemented, first full implementation, not tested task_queue.c - refactored, task_fill() method added, dequeue_task methods refactored to be pthread cancellable with releasing mutex i.e. pthread_cleanup_push(cleanup_unlock_mutex) and pthread_cleanup_pop()

thread_pool.c - refactored, added pthread_setcancelstate(), pthread_setcanceltype() calls in worker thread to enable DEFFERED cancellation of workers by pthread_cancel() calls while in thread_pool_free() method
thread_pool.c - refactored, added workers counter resetting to 0 before worker threads cancellation in order to not self terminate while cancelling it
thread_pool.h, thread_pool.c - refactored, added thread_pool_shutdown() method to gracefully shut down thread pool
thread_pool.h, thread_pool.c - refactored, thread_pool_free() -> thread_pool_force_free()
thread_pool.h, thread_pool.c - new functions: thread_pool_pause() - to stop all worker threads, and thread_pool_resume() - to resume previously stopped worker threads

doubly_linked_list.h, doubly_linked_list.c - reimplemented to use special allocator_t struct with allocate_handler_t func and deallocate_handler_t func to properly allocate/deallocate data in nodes while the list is the owner of the data. It can also store simple pointers to data and leaves client as the owner of data stored in nodes who remains responsible for proper deallocation of data.
doubly_linked_list.h, doubly_linked_list.c - bugs fixed, allocator struct changed to allocate generic data store rather than specific node, test written and passed
thread_pool.c, task_pool.c - fixed bug in worker thread cancellation i.e. cleanup handlers pushing on the stack and proper popping them off the stack after ETIMEDOUT
test_thread_pool.c - updated, randomization of sleep time, assertion, counting runners and task num sum numbers.c, numbers.h - range_rand(min, max)

thread_pool.c - fix some bugs: free( thread_id) - joining suffice, pthread_equal() returning 0 on equality rather than non-zero by negation of the simple result, reimplementing logic of thread_pool_adjust_size() by adding workers_running_count to take into account workers currently executing long running tasks as negligible from the perspective of tasks waiting in the queue. So, enabling real increase of number of worker threads while adjusting and when there are no handled tasks queued.
thread_pool.c, thread_pool.h - bugs fixed, tested and working (: test_thread_pool.c, test_thread_pool.h - completed and tested
threads_manager concept in thread.h, thread.c

threads_manager.h, threads_manager.c - first draft as separeted from thread.h, thread.c wait_for_connection_thread(), wait_for_datagram_thread(), timed_wait_for_connection_thread(), timed_wait_for_datagram_thread()

thread.h, thread.c - reimplemented to fit new concept of separated threads and runners commonly used by threads_manager or thread_pool or solely runner.h, runner.c - implementation of connection thread runner and datagram thread runner that fits runner interface
threads_manager.h, threads_manager.c - implemented, not tested thread.h, thread.c - reimplemented

test_threads_manager.h, test_threads_manager.c - implemented and tested server_loop.h, server_loop.c - implementation of TCP iterative, concurrent, managed concurrent and thread pool stream server loop.
server_loop.h, server_loop.c - implemented UDP server loops: iterative, concurrent, managed concurrent, thread pooled
server_loop.h, server_loop.c - implemented pseudo concurrent TCP server loop using select() and fd_set.
server - changed partition of source code into libraries
test_transfer.h, test_transfer.c - first draft
test display stream transfer with lz4 compression and exclusion of heap allocation
test display stream updates transfer with lz4 compression and exclusion of heap allocation
test display stream updates transfer with lz4 compression and exclusion of heap allocation
test_transfer_osx.c - contains code extracted from test_transfer.c which is specific for OS X CMakeLists.txt - updated to support Windows Cygwin build
make.txt - updated to support Windows Cygwin build
rc_server tested to work on MacOS, refactored test_transfer_osx.c and test_transfer.c includes.

MESSAGE.value: thread_pool.c - refactored, added pthread_setcancelstate(), pthread_setcanceltype() calls in worker thread to enable DEFFERED cancellation of workers by pthread_cancel() calls while in thread_pool_free() method
thread_pool.c - refactored, added workers counter resetting to 0 before worker threads cancellation in order to not self terminate while cancelling it
thread_pool.h, thread_pool.c - refactored, added thread_pool_shutdown() method to gracefully shut down thread pool
thread_pool.h, thread_pool.c - refactored, thread_pool_free() -> thread_pool_force_free()
thread_pool.h, thread_pool.c - new functions: thread_pool_pause() - to stop all worker threads, and thread_pool_resume() - to resume previously stopped worker threads

doubly_linked_list.h, doubly_linked_list.c - reimplemented to use special allocator_t struct with allocate_handler_t func and deallocate_handler_t func to properly allocate/deallocate data in nodes while the list is the owner of the data. It can also store simple pointers to data and leaves client as the owner of data stored in nodes who remains responsible for proper deallocation of data.
doubly_linked_list.h, doubly_linked_list.c - bugs fixed, allocator struct changed to allocate generic data store rather than specific node, test written and passed
thread_pool.c, task_pool.c - fixed bug in worker thread cancellation i.e. cleanup handlers pushing on the stack and proper popping them off the stack after ETIMEDOUT
test_thread_pool.c - updated, randomization of sleep time, assertion, counting runners and task num sum numbers.c, numbers.h - range_rand(min, max)

thread_pool.c - fix some bugs: free( thread_id) - joining suffice, pthread_equal() returning 0 on equality rather than non-zero by negation of the simple result, reimplementing logic of thread_pool_adjust_size() by adding workers_running_count to take into account workers currently executing long running tasks as negligible from the perspective of tasks waiting in the queue. So, enabling real increase of number of worker threads while adjusting and when there are no handled tasks queued.
thread_pool.c, thread_pool.h - bugs fixed, tested and working (: test_thread_pool.c, test_thread_pool.h - completed and tested
threads_manager concept in thread.h, thread.c

thread.h, thread.c - reimplemented to fit new concept of separated threads and runners commonly used by threads_manager or thread_pool or solely runner.h, runner.c - implementation of connection thread runner and datagram thread runner that fits runner interface
